body.p: Milton Purdy being in custody charged with the offense of shooting & wounding in sudden heat & passion & intent to kill and being admitted to bail in the sum of four hundred dollars:

hereby undertake that the above named Purdy will appear in the Muhlenberg Circuit Court on the first day of its next May term to answer said charge and will at all times render himself amenable to the orders and process of said Court in the prosecution of said charge, and if convicted will render himself in execution thereof, or, if he shall fail to perform either of these conditions, that we will pay to the Commonwelath of Kentucky the sum of four hundred dollars. Witness our hands this 30th day of March 1863.

Test
B. J. Shaver P.J.
Milton Purdy
